metadata.Title: CVE-2011-5037 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Google V8 computes hash values for form parameters without restricting the ability to trigger hash collisions predictably, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) by sending many crafted parameters, as demonstrated by attacks against Node.js.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-5037` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libv8-3.14.5 - 3.14.5.8-5ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libv8-3.14 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.14.5.8-5ubuntu1').
